state.full: You're full if you've eaten your fill. You can't eat any more food while full.
state.sated: You're sated if you've eaten recently but you've still got room for a bit more.
state.peckish: You're peckish if you're ready for your next meal.
state.hungry: You're hungry if your stomach is growling and you're starting to feel a bit weak.
state.starving: You're starving if everything reminds you of food and you're feeling weak and tired.

effect.full: After 1 hour of being full, you become sated.
effect.sated: After 4 hours of being sated, you become peckish.
effect.peckish: After 8 hours of being peckish, you become hungry.
effect.hungry: After 16 hours of being hungry, you gain 1 Fatigue and become starving.
effect.starving: For every 24 hours you are starving, you gain 1 additional Fatigue.

recovery.full: You become full by eating a full meal.
recovery.sated: You become sated by eating a snack or light meal.
recovery.peckish: You become peckish naturally over time after digestion.
recovery.hungry: You become hungry after going too long without food.
recovery.starving: You recover from starving by eating at least one full meal and resting.

state.quenched: You're quenched if you've drunk as much as you can. Drinking more beverages while quenched has no effect.
state.hydrated: You're hydrated if you've drunk recently but could still drink more if desired.
state.thirsty: You're thirsty if you've not had anything to drink in a while.
state.dehydrated: You're dehydrated if you're dizzy, suffering headaches, and feeling sluggish.

effect.quenched: After 1 hour of being quenched, you become hydrated.
effect.hydrated: After 2 hours of being hydrated, you become thirsty.
effect.thirsty: After 4 hours of being thirsty, you gain 1 Fatigue and become dehydrated.
effect.dehydrated: For every 8 hours you are dehydrated, gain 1 additional Fatigue.

recovery.quenched: You become quenched by drinking a full container of clean water.
recovery.hydrated: You become hydrated by sipping from a canteen or similar source.
recovery.thirsty: You become thirsty naturally over time without water.
recovery.dehydrated: You recover from dehydration by drinking a large amount of water and resting.

state.rested: You're rested if you've recently had a proper sleep. You might be well-rested if it was especially good.
state.tired: You're tired if you're no longer fully alert, but you're still functioning.
state.weary: You're weary when you really need some rest but are still capable of acting.
state.exhausted: You're exhausted if you're on the verge of collapsing, pushing yourself to stay awake.

effect.rested: After 8 hours of being rested, you become tired.
effect.tired: After 8 hours of being tired, you gain 1 Fatigue and become weary.
effect.weary: After 8 hours of being weary, you gain 1 Fatigue and become exhausted.
effect.exhausted: For every 4 hours you are exhausted, you gain 1 additional Fatigue.

recovery.rested: You become rested by getting 6-8 hours of uninterrupted sleep.
recovery.tired: You become tired naturally after being awake for a long time.
recovery.weary: You become weary by pushing past your usual sleep cycle.
recovery.exhausted: You recover from exhaustion by sleeping for at least 6 hours and stopping all physical activity.
